text: John Frederic Daniell was born. He would grow up to invent the Daniell cell, a battery that supplied an even current during continuous operation, thus making battery power practical.
Almon B. Strowger of Kansas City filed his patent for the first automatic telephone exchange.
Inventor Lee De Forest demonstrated The Phonofilm for the press. It was the first motion picture with a sound-on-film track.
Tim Berners-Lee wrote a paper proposing an "information management" system that became the foundation of the World Wide Web. He called it the Mesh at the time.
